intro: Mariscus ancistrophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mariscus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. Mariscus ancistrophyllus is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
